website_summaries.verdict: Aptly named, the Maker enables almost any DIY project you can imagine. Vinyl cutting is just one of its many possibilities.
pros: Cuts hundreds of materials, from vinyl to leather and balsa wood
Includes rotary blade, other blades, pens, and scoring tools
Docking slot for tablet or smartphone
cons: Software can be buggy, and some of the most advanced capabilities are still forthcoming

website_summaries.verdict: This is Cricut's crème de la crème for the serious crafter. It can handle paper, wood, leather, and fabric.
pros: Quilters can cut fabric without using heat and bond
Also works with delicate fabrics like lace
cons: Some owners are frustrated by the software, saying it is not as user-friendly as they would like

website_summaries.verdict: Upload your own patterns or create impromptu work backed by sophisticated technology.
pros: Cuts patterns for fashion, function, and much more
Creative freedom to upload own patterns
Will unleash your creative genius with results you and others will love
cons: Works with a variety of materials, but may not be the best option for heat transfer vinyl

customer_reviews.title: Endless project potential
customer_reviews.text: First, if you’re new to die cutting, expect a learning curve. Second, if you experience technical issues, contact cricut support; they are very helpful. The software is user friendly once you learn the ins and outs of it. Device connectivity is sometimes glitchy if you have a Mac computer but was easily resolved with help from cricut support. The Maker is the Cadillac of die cutting with endless projects that can be completed. To get it’s full use you really need to buy additional blades (to cut wood or leather). Despite a frustrating setup, I love my Maker.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Here’s the machine now go figure it out on your own.
customer_reviews.text: Just unboxed this and am very upset. The materials for your 1st project are beautifully presented in an elegant black folder, and the let down is when you open it — tiny square of fabric, tiny square of other material (vinyl?) and 1/3 sheet of construction paper. Onto the machine and instructions- except the instruction book is a catalog of accessories you can buy — No getting started instructions. No customer service phone number either. $400+ to have to go to You Tube to try to figure out how it works? I don’t think so!
customer_reviews.author: KR

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BELIEVE THE HYPE
customer_reviews.text: Bought this machine to cut balsa wood as advertised. Cricut has delayed knife blade release twice now - now no definite release in site. I feel their advertising was deceptive - it still says it can cut wood - it can't. Also, Cricut design Space very clunky - cannot accept Adobe Illustrator SVG's with fold/score lines so every design has to be redesigned inside Design Space which is a hassle. Really disappointed with this machine & Cricut company. I would have stuck with Silhouette (great design software) but I fell for the advertising without doing research.
customer_reviews.author: JJKKAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Thank You
customer_reviews.text: Machine did not connect to my computer. Many technical issues that followed. I had so many issues with this thing. This machine is not for beginners. In order to operate this machine, you have to have internet access. You need to login and design online. You have to spend hours and hours of YouTube tutorials in order to get the hang of it. Tools are separate. It can all add up. I consider myself a computer-savy person, but Cricut tested my patience to say the least. I was very annoyed with the amount of time you have to devote to each project.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Santos Salinas

customer_reviews.title: Wish I'd read the reviews FIRST!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work offline. That renders it useless to me. Setup was extremely counter intuitive. Had to go find/install drivers -- haven't had to do that since the 90's. DesignSpace arbitrarily resizes and rotates images. You never really know what you're going to end up with. As best I can tell, the folks at Cricut don't even acknowledge they have a problem nor does it appear they're even trying to fix it. Horrible software. If any of my Computer Science 101 students had ever submitted code like that, they'd have repeated the semester! Don't know if I can get my money back but I'm going to try. If you're reading this then you're better off than I.
customer_reviews.author: Saint

customer_reviews.title: This machine does not do what it claims it will do.  Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: This was the biggest waste of money I have spent yet to date. I had high hopes for this and was excited to offer the "wood cutting, leather cutting, and engraving" to the items I could provide to my customers. Even with the mats and blades they require and offer NONE of these features would work. The wood was horrible and the leather cut but was frayed and choppy looking so none could be resold. I am very disappointed and feel like if you are looking for these features you will be sadly disappointed and as I should have went and researched and watched the youtube videos that show this will not work but did not.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Price

customer_reviews.title: No longer working after two uses
customer_reviews.text: We got our Maker machine a little over a week ago, and it has already stopped working after it's second use, we get the "Scoring Wheel Not Detected" error message even though the scoring wheel is correctly loaded. I'm really upset, I ordered this machine because Cricut has been around for a few years and the Maker was the most versatile and the most expensive, I did not think I would have any issues. Doing some searching there are several other people with the same issue, do a search "Scoring Wheel Not Detected". I'm very frustrated right now!
customer_reviews.author: Christophor Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Software is garbage and is "cloud based"... Also never works.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my wife for Christmas. She went to set it up and play with it today and the site isn't working. Looked at their FB page and all it is is people complaining about the software not working. Apparently this has been the issue for years. Of course it's outside of the return scope, so we are sitting here with a (by the time you count supplies, accessories, ect) a $500 paperweight. This is one of the most disappointing purchases I have ever made. For the same money, there are MUCH better options.
customer_reviews.author: ix3u

customer_reviews.title: Careful with Teenagers
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this particular machine because it could do fabric as well as cardstock and other items. I made one mistake when it arrived though. I told my teenager about it. Now my daughter who is lucky to emerge from her room for food won't get out of my office. She is constantly wanting to make something new and I haven't been able to use it yet. It seems to work really well for her and I have only had to help her with a couple slight adjustments (rushing to fast to follow directions). I hope one day I will be able to get my craft desk back from the teen and try this out for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Useless when Cricut's Design Space cloud software goes down
customer_reviews.text: Went to make a vinyl design tonight and Cricut's design space kept trying to reload the page. All my projects are gone and the machine would connect, but due to Design Space trying to constantly reload the page, it froze. If I could do it over again, I would look for a vinyl cutting machine that let's the software be put on the computer. Cricut and my experience with their software is why I will never rely on cloud based software for important matter.
customer_reviews.author: Micheal

customer_reviews.title: I would not buy this proprietary money pit!
customer_reviews.text: the software is horrific! don't take my word for it- go online and see what others are saying... If you want to pay hundreds of dollars to make slightly customizable greeting cards then maybe?? you will also need to buy there patterns and accessories and then slog through there "software" or lameware to get that blazay item made. there are other none cricket operating software packets available as long as you are comfortable modding firmware. I ordered it to cut out consistent patterns in thin leather but gave up and now it sits in the closet.
customer_reviews.author: Toby J. Thew

customer_reviews.title: not for model railroaders
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get my my Cricut Maker. I spent over $500 on Machine and add-ons . So disappointed! First you can't pick the cutter, the material and thickness you want. You have to chose from a "list" that's for "crafters". This machine has so much potential if it wasn't for the software you have to use. I had it for a month made a couple of thin, small projects but could tell the software wasn't going to let me do what the "machine' was capable of! The Cricut Maker is a well made machine(ten stars here) but the "product" package is flawed by the poor software. sold it for $300 :(
customer_reviews.author: C Baker

customer_reviews.title: Stop Reading Reviews & Get the Maker!
customer_reviews.text: After going back and forth between Cricuts, I’m so happy I got the Maker! This machine does so much. I feel like I’ve went back to school at almost 50 years old. I’ve found YouTube to be my best friend and am doing so many more things than what I originally purchased my Maker to do. Things I couldn’t have done with any other Cricut. If you’re on the fence, go ahead and get the Maker. Otherwise you’ll probably end up upgrading to it later.
customer_reviews.author: JBeth

customer_reviews.title: You can make anything!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift from my husband and it's perfect! I love the fact that you can cut fabric with it (with the included rotatery blade!) as well as other materials beside the expected paper and card stock. You do need a different blade for cutting heavy items, such as leather and balsa wood. I am planning on order a scoring housing first though (it's also rotary) as well as some of the markers. I comes with one marker (black) and it works great. You also get materials to make your first project, a cute card, that the online site walks you through. There are also tons of videos available to learn from.
customer_reviews.author: Luanne613

customer_reviews.title: Hoping replacement works
customer_reviews.text: Dissappointed...had a project I wanted to do...Received product and it never turned on. Checked everything...connections. sending back. Hope the replacement works.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing tool. I Purchased it as a gift for my wife and I have affectively replaced myself with it in her life. 😜😜 She uses it many hours every day and has created unimaginable craft projects of every variety there is literally nothing in our home has not been labeled decorated or otherwise improved. The variety of materials that can be used and cut is remarkable. The Percision with which it cuts is without compare. variety of materials that can be used and cut is remarkable. The Percision with which it cuts is without compare 5!stars
customer_reviews.author: DJMC2002

customer_reviews.title: returned
customer_reviews.text: I make bags for a living. I wanted to cut shapes out of leather to put on the bags. I had the right cutter, pads, etc. 1. takes a very long time for one cut. 2. Was messy. Not a clean cut. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela J. LeBlanc

customer_reviews.title: Cricut Maker Mint
customer_reviews.text: The cricut maker did not come as new as advertised. The mats are used as you can see cuts already made on them. The first project materials packet had nothing in it. The "lets just started" cards only had 1 and 4.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Initial impression is not good but jury is still out?
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Cricut Maker a couple of weeks ago. When I tried it out, it seemed to cut paper but when I tried to use the rotary cutting blade, it malfunctioned and basically destroyed the blade and cutting mat...then the machine died. I called customer service (45 minutes on hold before I spoke to someone): they were very nice but suggested that the power supply was the problem and they sent a new one (and that took a week). No change. On the phone with them again today (not so bad: 30 minutes on hold); I am now waiting for a resolution as the service representative said that the issue has to be referred to a supervisor.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Learning curve but an amazing machine
customer_reviews.text: The maker allows for you to make your own designs (only with a pc) otherwise you can use the app to buy images and fonts through cricut. For my purposes, this was perfect. It has a bit of a learning curve and the free software isn't perfect but the machine works wonderfully. My first real project is stencil making and I figured out that if the image or letter is too small then there isn't much to weed out of a hole (negative images for stencils can get tricky). Simple and lovely hardware, can get complicated when it comes to the software.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: BE PREPARED TO INVEST YOUR TIME AND MONEY IN THIS!
customer_reviews.text: Hobbies are never cheap and this one is not on the cheaper end of hobbies. This beautiful light rose gold Maker is a mean machine. It's VERY overwhelming if you have no experience, but it takes a lot of error and trials to learn the curve. Spend a lot of time practicing and watching lots of YouTube videos. I find it a bit user friendly, but it could use some improvement to make things a bit easier. I'd say spend a little bit more of money to get the Maker.
customer_reviews.author: Tine

customer_reviews.title: Mats come bent in box.
customer_reviews.text: Love the machine Hate how the mats come bent almort in half in smar box. I get they're trying to save on size of box for shipping, but not cool for the price paid. Normally I'd be like whooptydo, but its been a pain trying to align mat while bent whithout getting a crooked cut. Annoying to waste vinyl, esp with large cuts when a slight crooked/angle throws whole thing off the longer the cut. I've had them under weights for over a week and they still have a bend in them. :/
customer_reviews.author: Jm

customer_reviews.title: Love everything Cricut but this one is defective
customer_reviews.text: I have had and used Cricut since it's inception...the 6" bug, the 12", the Expression and presently have an Air 2. I've never had a problem with any of them. I decided to splurge and buy the Maker when I was making for my son's wedding. Everything went well for a few months but now my Maker won't connect to Bluetooth. I know it's not my computer because it's connecting to every other device with no problem. So while I love the Cricut Maker and what it can do, I'm sick that I spent all this money for a defective one. And the return window closed really quickly so now I'm stuck. That's why I gave it one star.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Research Before Purchasing
customer_reviews.text: If you have an older Apple device or Chromebook, you will not be able to use the design software or browse the Cricut catalogue at all. It is unfortunate that their is no support for multiple devices beyond Windows, especially when the Cricut Maker and necessary (but at an additional cost) tools costs so much. Once you purchase the machine and tools, you will then need to purchase a subscription service or purchase individually different projects. You can also design your own projects for free - as long as you have the appropritately supported computer or electronic device. The machine itself is quite large (think half the size of a home laser printer) but quiet.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: My new fave makers toy!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so in love with my birthday gift!!! I have made so many different projects already while in quarantine. The only thing I will say is there a learning curve in beginning. Maybe should have more info on how to first use. Also it is a little bit of a money pit. Cricut supplies and extra tools to create different projects cost $$$ So be prepared for that. Otherwise this machine is wonderful and does so many things. I'm obsessed!!
customer_reviews.author: Stargirl

customer_reviews.title: Love my cricut
customer_reviews.text: Super great tool for any crafter. I have procrastinated on buying one of these because of the price and I wasn't sure how much I would use it, but I LOVE IT. It has been super useful in a lot of projects from quilting to screen printing to costume making. It is easy to use and there are a lot of resources on Cricut's site. I would recommend this for any crafter, it has been a lot of fun to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dream it, cut it, show it, smile
customer_reviews.text: I am a teacher. My husband and I both love art and have a lot of great ideas for shirts and decals. We got to the point where we saw we were spending more money for other people to make shirts and decals for us, so we decided to buy our own cricut. As soon as we got it we were playing with the program and paint program on our computer. By the end of the week we had already made a few shirts and decals for cups and vehicles. This machine is amazing and we are extremely happy that we bought the cricut.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing Items
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used my Cricut Maker yet, but the box was supposed to include the lightweight mat. It was not in my box. I had planned to purchase extra mats separately anyway, but now that non-essential items have a shipping delay, I needed that mat to work on some time sensitive Mother's Day projects I'd planned. I'm disappointed, but this isn't about the machine itself. Additionally, in the envelope that says "Open Me First", I had steps 1, 3, and 4. There was no step "2" in the envelope. I'm guessing that this is a quality control issue, and hoping that everything works smoothly once all of my supplies finally arrive.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Product arrives quickly, issues with the software, not the machine
customer_reviews.text: Cool product if you can get it figured out. Software you download is not all that user friendly. For the price you pay this product albeit cool, is not worth the money charged. Machine works great once you master the software to run it, my complaint is in the software. Plan to download the software on your own and play around with it until you can understand how it works long before you sink your money into it. It is really cool and makes very professional looking things just don't plan to produce anything easily right out the box. Seller sent out product very quickly would buy from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just do it! You know you want to!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make stencils for my painting classes. But I actually use it for making store signs, decorating our aprons, making car decals, and personalized shirts (LIKE CRAZY!!) It is to the point I feel like I need to get a second one to keep up with the demand. It was quite daunting at first and I felt like I was overwhelmed, not knowing where to start. But once I did, I use this every day! The Maker allowes you to etch, engrave, and even cut thin wood. I have not used it for anything other than vinyl and paper, yet. I love the versatility of this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Huwe

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible
customer_reviews.text: i know the returned window is gone but i have not able to use this machine at all.... Try all possible ways to work with my pc lenovo windows 10 but a guess they do not like each other.... I have unstalled twice and install again and nothhing have worked i have calibrated my pc scree nothing i have used a different zomm and nothing the big problem is that my computer only shows part of the screen in Design space.... I would like to returned this machine please!!!! Escri
customer_reviews.author: Mary O.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful color, lots to learn
customer_reviews.text: On the learning curve so my review is based on my minimal experience and my much more experienced friend's opinions. 1st of all, the Champagne is a gorgeous color and the unit looks nice in my set up. 2nd, love the ability to make fun vinyl things, greeting cards and heat transfers. Out performs the competition and the Cricut world of available supplies to be creative with is amazing. The Sky is the limit truly applies here
customer_reviews.author: Spa Mama

customer_reviews.title: Things I was disappointed in. 1) Product appeared to be "rushed to ...
customer_reviews.text: Certainly more featured than our earlier Cricut. Bought as a Xmas gift for wife. Things I was disappointed in. 1) Product appeared to be "rushed to market" for Xmas season. .. Not all advertised options were available at time of purchase. 2) Cant transfer old projects from old design suite.Cloud mentality is limiting. No ability to store everything you need on your computer so you can work off line you must be connected to internet ....Cricut has joined the "nickel and dime you to death" subscription crowd. I very much resent this BUYER BEWARE those hands in your pockets are not your own.
customer_reviews.author: David Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Poor SVG support - activly prevents others from writing software to help
customer_reviews.text: The company is telling us that they support SVG imports - yet files from inkscape - the most common SVG software don't always load with out a lot of problems. Not only that - they sue people that have provided software to make their machines more usable.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: A used cricut machine
customer_reviews.text: This cricut maker is used. The lightgrip blue sticky board has all kinds of Mark's on it and doesnt have a protection cover. I opened up the envelop to find a letter I and a nut..Not happy! I believe after watching you tube I'm missing a blade also. spending a lot of money on someone else machine that returned it. So far the only thing I have tried is the sample cut. So, now I just guess why this machine was returned is it a lemon or did the previous owner find out she didnt have an interest in cricut crafting?
customer_reviews.author: brenda

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS MACHINE
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea that I needed this before I bought it. I decided to go with the Maker because I wanted the newest model, I liked that it could cut wood, and I liked that they were going to be coming out with more tools in the future. This was a great purchase for my business and is expanding everything that I'm able to do. I've already talked one of my friends into buying one too. LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn Webb

customer_reviews.title: Rethinking purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I like that I am able to cut a variety of material. Dislike that there is a limit to size and tools. Thought I was going to be able to produce a different type of craft but due to its limit on size and crash issues I have been having it is almost a complete waste of money. Everything has to be brought through cricut or the assembly will read as an error. Seen videos on how to get around this but not willing to take that chance.
customer_reviews.author: SpellsFamily

customer_reviews.title: It’s a gateway drug! And I can’t stop!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing, wonderful machine. A lot of possibility for any crafter. Very easy to use. Easy to setup. Wireless feature makes it even more convenient and easy to use. Accessories that are available are amazing. HOWEVER, purchasing this machine is opening a door, a possibly-very-expensive door - mats, materials, tools, supplies, accessories, vinyl, fabric, blah, blah, blah. I love this. LOVE it, but I have to stop myself from impulse shopping all the time now. “Ooh I love that vinyl...”
customer_reviews.author: Sonya

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am a teacher and I ordered this product to use for myself at home as well as for projects in my classroom. Having received the machine, I was excited to open and begin using it so I could learn what to do. I was disappointed; however, when I opened the box because, despite it's claims, it did not come with the materials for my first project, instructions, or the Rotary Blade and Fine Point Pen. Having said that, I just opened the box and discovered the problem yesterday so I have not yet addressed this with Amazon. I hope to rectify the situation soon though.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Warehouse deals are amazing
customer_reviews.text: Had my eye on a Cricut Maker, but price kept fluctuating wildly. One day I saw one listed by Amazon Warehouse. After learning that returned items are often listed on Amazon Warehouse I decided to take a chance. The item was listed in Very Good condition so I expected it had been used. It was also $100 less than the cheapest place I had seen it for (excluding the local sales tax I would have had to pay). Couldn’t believe it when I received the package. Brand new item! Definitely will be on the lookout for items from Amazon Warehouse. P.S. Loving the machine. YouTube videos have flattened the learning curve for Design Space.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Easy
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife to help cut out patterns, and setup with the app made things super easy. Uploading patterns took a second to figure out at first, but honestly was most surprised by the marketplace I had no idea existed, ha ha. Lots of stuff there, mostly costing a buck or two, but they had something I was going to try to make on my own for like 99 cents, so that was sweet.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Schmalfeldt

customer_reviews.title: Beware - seriously addicting!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Maker on a whim while being bored at work, now all I want to do is make things with it.
customer_reviews.author: Aleksandra Pimenova

customer_reviews.title: Curled cutting boards
customer_reviews.text: The boards were curled from packaging. I tried taking the curls out for the boards to lie flat without success. The glitter-type vinyl that I tried cutting in the maker did not provide a clean cut. It appears the vinyl was too thick. I tried a thinner vinyl and consistently make the cut. This could because the board was not flat. I used the blade that was in the Cricut Maker upon arrival. The main purpose for purchasing the Maker is for vinyl cutting. I will try using the extra blade that came with it for cutting the heavier vinyl and if it does not work well, I am returning it. back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It should be so much easier to use...
customer_reviews.text: The user interface appears easy at first, BUT it is neither intuitive nor user friendly. I can literally think of hundreds of improvements to their software. Actually they need to completely rethink their software. I would be ashamed of releasing it. The machine may have tons of potential but I don’t have time to waste figuring out its eccentricities. I didn’t buy it to be “crafty”, I just needed it to work like a printer. Ie: Plug it in, and start cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Owaleon

customer_reviews.title: I looooove it.
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny. I just dont like how you have to buy everything u want to do on the app. Or buy the fonts and all that Other than that the machine itself is the best. Fast and easy to use. I just been using it for banners and cards. But when I'm ready to do all that material and sewing and bigger projects it will be ready.this matchine is so cool and so addicting once you learn how to use it. :)
customer_reviews.author: JOANNA MIRANDA

customer_reviews.title: The Machine I Always Wanted - You Do Too! (Trust Me)
customer_reviews.text: I have been eyeing this machine for years. I was surprised one day that they made a machine that is pretty much can cut and create everything! I have a cake business on the side and this is just an awesome addition to my tools. I won't be crazy hunting for some rare materials on cake decorating knowing this can do fondant too! Such a great investment especially if you make and sell crafts, personalized items, souvenirs and many, many more.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo B.

customer_reviews.title: Okay, Okay, Okay, there is a learning curve here, but all is GOOD
customer_reviews.text: We love this device and it does more than we anticipated on. Prepare yourself......you get started on this device and craft ideas, you will be spending money on many craft accessories and supplies. Don't be afraid, this is well worth the investment if you like crafts and designs, and this Cricut Maker machine is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: FuzzyNavel

customer_reviews.title: Too much spending/cost after purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was most excited to buy a cricut maker as I’ve wanted a Cricut for years. But this is now my experience: 1. The “free” images in their design space is only “free” for a couple uses. After a while you need to pay for them. 2. The cutting mat these changing more often than you’d expect. I’d say after 40 to 50 cuts you need to budget in for a new mat as it then affects the quality of future cuts and cause serious material wastage. 3. May not be a problem for you, but the machine is loud. Am so disappointed by 1 & 2 above, am regretting choosing a Cricut over the Brother comparative.
customer_reviews.author: Sher1

customer_reviews.title: My GF loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my GF for Christmas.... we set it up and now I never see her. But I get really cool stickers! Lol. She loves it. She does stickers and stencils for sewing.
customer_reviews.author: Islandwrath

customer_reviews.title: Great for custom work
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my girlfriend for Christmas and she loved it. It was probably a mistake because she became obsessed with it and now spends a lot of money. This is a great product that allows you to custom make stickers and shirts with the vinyl. This is a great buy to make custom projects.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Trinidad

customer_reviews.title: Makers are best! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love my maker! Opened and Etsy and made some good money so far! Can’t wait to be able to use all that this machine offers!
customer_reviews.author: Lillian Chubbuck

customer_reviews.title: BEST MACHINE
customer_reviews.text: So I got this for my wife and its a pretty cool machine. Did a lot of research on all of the cutting machines and this one seems like it was the best. The other ones where limited on what they could cut. Since this machine isn't cheap it was an investment so I went big and got this one. If we are going to have it might as well be able to cut everything. I took a star off easy to use because I had a hard time cutting trees out. Its been a fun learning experience.
customer_reviews.author: ~Dillon~

customer_reviews.title: Mechanical issues
customer_reviews.text: I love the cricut products I’ve been using them for a while; I ordered this to upgrade and I’ve used it twice and it stopped working on me. And amazon only gives a small return or exchange period, so now I can’t get it replaced with amazon; and I’ve been trying to get ahold of cricut for a few weeks now.. now I’m out so much money. Behind on a few dozen projects. I’m not a happy camper..
customer_reviews.author: Summer Schnapp

customer_reviews.title: Got sent a used machine already registered to someone else and did not work correctly!
customer_reviews.text: Down 10 days now until new machine, replacement machine will arrive directly from Cricut themselves this time!! Machine arrived and would not recognize or work with any of the tools. After talking to the customer service at Cricut this machine was already previously registered to another user!!! :( so I got sent a machine used that was not functioning or working correctly for full price!!! NOT HAPPY!!! Will only buy directly through Cricut from now on. BE CAREFUL PEOPLE!!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin DeLibero

customer_reviews.title: Only Works With Their Web Software
customer_reviews.text: You have to use their terrible software and it’s entirely web-based. We have to wait several minutes just to get a print dialogue, which means test prints take forever. Unacceptable. If I could use this with any software, like any other printer, it would probably get a much better review. Another star docked because of the maximum depth. We thought we were going to be able to print on all kinds of materials but I can’t find hardly anything that will fit in there that’s much thicker than paper.
customer_reviews.author: H. Webster

customer_reviews.title: This thing is pretty rad
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing, my only beef is the software. You have to do everything through a web browser, which in theory is really cool cus I can use my phone iPad or my computer. But coming up from the 3d printing side of things I’d rather have an open source program that that sits on my desktop, that way I’m not worried about my internet failing while I work.
customer_reviews.author: eli perry

customer_reviews.title: Not enough OS support
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of the lack of OS support for Linux and even earlier Windows. Machine works fine, software does not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: broke after one use, customer service non existent!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered back in November 2019. Haven’t been able to use because cricut machine only powered on once. Read reviews and this is common. Cricut customer service is so horrible that they still haven’t offered any solution as of July 22, 2020
customer_reviews.author: Even D

customer_reviews.title: Awesomeness.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my daughter. She has mastered using this machine and has made numerous items with it. She is able to create many wonderful items, for everyone. It's just awesome. It works well and does such a great job. It has the ability to make so many projects.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Complete Frustration.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Cricut Maker after reading a review on Wirecutter.com. I really wanted to love this machine. Unfortunately, it's not working out and hence I'm going to return it. For one thing, I prefer a non-Internet-based application. The Cricut stopped in the middle of a project cut and the error message indicated a faulty Internet. Mostly though, I'm returning the product because of the inaccurate cuts. I bought this for the purpose of cutting kiss-cut stickers and the alignment was off for half the page of stickers. It didn't matter how much I adjusted the cut image, every cut project resulted in inaccurate cuts and wasted material.
customer_reviews.author: DVP

customer_reviews.title: broken machine
customer_reviews.text: My cricut came broken blinking red and white lights - tried to resch cricut customer service for serveral days i have emails that I would be responded too in 72 hours thay was 5 days ago waited on chat for 2 days a total of 7 hours FOR NOTHING. Emailed. Cricut 4 times, facebook messaged cricut, tried to call, tried chat -almost 1000 total in cricut material to have it 2 weeks and not be able to use it! Will be returning
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy a Cricut Maker until they resolve. Seems to be known problem, if you google it.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in the Cricut maker. The rubber stopper for the mat keeps moving. Since it’s under warranty, I’ve tried contacting Cricut, but they had too many caller and told me to send an email. Which I did 4 days ago, and still haven’t heard anything back from them. I have orders that are delayed until they decide to do something. Very disappointed. I should never have given up my Cricut Air 2. Update 8/14 - it’s been 9 days since I sent Cricut an email about my defective Cricut Maker - still no reply- any way to return it thru Amazon and I can order a new one?
customer_reviews.author: Valerie J. Biggs

customer_reviews.title: I received a used one
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my first Cricut maker and so excited to open it as soon as it arrived. However, when I opened a box, I see a very old cricut box - the edge was torn up. When I opened a cricut box, I didn't feel that I have a new machine. there is even a pen stain on the machine. I paid for a new machine not the old one. Now I have to carry the heavy box and return it to Kohl's. So disappointed and upset.
customer_reviews.author: Eun Jung

customer_reviews.title: The Cricut Maker is amazing and fun to use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine to play with vinyl, but it can do so much more. I love how precise the cuts are and how you can mix the different types of tools in a single project. For instance, Putting cut lines to cut out material, using the pen to draw designs on the same piece. Or, cutting fabric and using a fabric marker to label your piece and put any markings you need for alignment etc...
customer_reviews.author: Eric D.

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT, BUT.......
customer_reviews.text: LOVE MY MACHINE. EVERYTHING WORKS PERFECT. BUT WHEN YOU ORDER HER FROM AMAZON YOU DO NOT GET ALL THE COUPONS THAT ALL YOUR FRIENDS TELL YOU THAT WILL COME IN BOX. APPARENTLY YOU ONLY GET THE COUPONS IF YOU ORDER FROM CIRCUT DIRECTLY...
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Hendren

customer_reviews.title: WORTH IT
customer_reviews.text: if you are here in the comments and looking for that comment you want to see lol ---> DO IT, i think i hesitated for too long to get myself the machine, i love it, i have done soo many cute things with it, if you have the time and maybe money to buy the materials, then YES (don't let that make you think about it) , it is time consuming but tbh if you are into crafts then you won't complain at all, worth the money since you can make soo many stuff, let me know in your reviews if you do :D
customer_reviews.author: Nelly Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Packaging Error
customer_reviews.text: The product is great and I love it so far however when it arrived it came with two mats that I cannot even use because of how bent they were in packaging. Im not sure how to make them flat again I tried placing heavy books on them for to days to flatten them out but it didnt work at all. So this was the only thin I was really upset about.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Berumen

customer_reviews.title: I love this machine
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. I have the original Cricut Expression and purchased the Air last year but this machine is amazing!! I create products using chipboard and other hard materials. This machine makes cutting simply easier and quicker. Very user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Stafford

customer_reviews.title: Just go for it!
customer_reviews.text: This product right here speaks for itself. This is fun and oh so pretty. There is a learning curve but not too difficult. I did not get a cutie (Cricut figurine) with this product which most manufacturers give one when you buy a Cricut so that was disappointing but otherwise so fun and a great addition to my craft room! It cuts wood, engraves, cuts vinyl, paper and so so much more!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Baer

customer_reviews.title: Love cricut.
customer_reviews.text: I have used cricut before so I was already knowledgeable about how to set up and run the machine. I own and operate a craft store and use this for soooooo many things. It was well worth the price tag!
customer_reviews.author: AmandaMCBryant

customer_reviews.title: cricut is awful.
customer_reviews.text: I spent 380 on a machine and 10 days in I CANT USE IT!!!! ARE YOU SERIOUS!!!!
customer_reviews.author: alexcia sterling

customer_reviews.title: MY MATS ARE HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: I'm soooo upset, received my cricut two days ago and my mats arrived like this. I attempted to smooth them out by placing large books, but it didn't work. All of the projects I attempted tonight are ruined because of both mats😡 Why would whoever placed them in the box rolled up instead to laying it flat down inside the box😡😡😡
customer_reviews.author: TAMIKA

customer_reviews.title: Excitement to Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Received my cricut on time. Was super excited about playing with it straight out the box. Unfortunately, while trying to do my “first” cut I received the FLASHING RED POWER BUTTON. I was so irritated. Attempt to call Cricut customer service. Was told I had a 15 minute wait. Was actually waiting for 2 hours before hanging up. Decided to return and order a replacement. I truly hope the replacement is new and working. Will update.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica

customer_reviews.title: Need internet to use it.
customer_reviews.text: The only negative I have for this is that you MUST have Cricut Design Space to use it. If the program, which is only available through an internet connection, is down or you have no internet, you cannot use it. I hear that Cricut is working on a standalone program but until it's available it is at the whim if my network connection. Otherwise this thing is great and does everything it says it does.
customer_reviews.author: LEE

customer_reviews.title: Shop around 1st
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my wife so I’m hoping is what she truly wanted. As for pricing, my suggestion is to look locally first. I could have bought the same for $329 at Michael’s.
customer_reviews.author: ren

customer_reviews.title: Get it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Had a silhouette and returned it because it cut worse than my manual sizzix. Got this and it was a great choice! This is a small business owners dream because you can create everything from business cards to labels to signs. I mainly bought it for making handbound books and embossing leather. It can do so much more. Love it. Love it. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Joshua hemming

customer_reviews.title: SO DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: The rubber roller that pulls the mat in and out is completely SHREDDING! It also moves to the left and pulls the mat with it, completely destroying the materials being cut. I've been on hold for 3 hours trying to get an answer and have put in a help ticket and haven't heard from anyone. My machine is only 5 months old. Such a disappointment...
customer_reviews.author: Lynnett Price

customer_reviews.title: I love my Cricut Maker
customer_reviews.text: I am a long-time crafter and wood worker. I wanted a new craft and after seeing my daughter's Cricut Air 2, I decided to make the plunge and get myself a Cricut Maker. The price was much better on Amazon than in any of the local craft stores or on Cricut's website. It also arrived when promised - an added plus.
customer_reviews.author: shoup91

customer_reviews.title: Great product. But, doesn't come with Supplies
customer_reviews.text: Got for wife, she loves it. Doesn't come with any film to star using. Had to find store that sells films. Now after a year trying to find places that stock stuff to use it. Wal-Mart stocks it now. Dec 2018
customer_reviews.author: James Lee

customer_reviews.title: Expensive add one and accessories
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed by how much consumables cost. There’s some trade-offs between ease of use so it’s a good machine. Not the easiest to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L

customer_reviews.title: Amazing machine
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with my Maker. After having my Air 2 for almost 2 years I was thrilled when the Maker went on sale. It was the cheapest I've ever seen it. Love it! So far everything is working as it should be. Can't wait to be able to cut all the different materials that my Air2 could not.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Best craft investment!
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase I've ever made! This thing is so fun and you can do souch with it! Personalized signs, shirts, drinkware... You name it! Buy one and start crafting!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Beaty

customer_reviews.title: POS
customer_reviews.text: I used it once and it seemed a little weird but it got the job done. Tried another project and it kept cutting the Matt and not the vinyl so I set it said a bit thinking it was me. I tried it again and. Ow it’s just stabbing the paper in the same 1” square. I’ve tried everything I could find online and I’ve got nothing. Guess I just wasted that money
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: cutting crepe paper is difficult
customer_reviews.text: I make crepe paper flowers. The Cricut would cut initially and then only score. I tried multiple settings and none of them worked. The paper I used was Lia Griffith double sided crepe paper. I spent more time trying to resolve the problem than cutting manually. And Customer Service is non existent as well as the Search Help. So disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Missing items
customer_reviews.text: The online description as well as the "included in the box" of the setup guide says there should be 2 cutting mats. There are no mats in the box. Send me the missing items and I will adjust the review
customer_reviews.author: Joy Bloom

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to have if you enjoy crafts
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my wife's bday. She's always wanted one and wish I didn't wait. Its takes some learning on how to use the software but clearly this can do many things. Anything from decals, shirts, cards, etc. If your crafty and into home projects, this is a great thing to have.
customer_reviews.author: Regmeister

customer_reviews.title: Unless you have thousands of dollars to spend why buy anything else?
customer_reviews.text: Morning this device is not exactly easy however it does what it is supposed to
customer_reviews.author: M. Wall

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this machine. Cricut did a great job when they designed it. It's much more sturdy than the Explorer line and its precision is outstanding! It was able to cut the most detailed projects. It greatly outperforms my old Explorer machine and would highly recommend saving up for the Maker model.
customer_reviews.author: Kiiyo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to learn
customer_reviews.text: From when I setup the machine it came with index cards of how to set it up has a few materials that allows you to do a test project from their creative program upon setup and from there you just follow directions on screen I made a very complex looking flower out of the card stock sample given it came out really good just wish that they would have spared you a small craft remover tool to get it of the adhesive mat but I made due with something and kind of wrinkled parts try to remove it
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lilly

customer_reviews.title: The best cricut and for its price!
customer_reviews.text: I’m am very happy I got this cricut, it’s an amazing price, the color is beautiful compared to the others, and it was easy to use. Project turns out great and cutting too. The con to this, is I wish they instructed you more on how to create things off the design space, because I kept getting lost or confused.... but the product itself, you won’t be disappointed 🙂
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy itif you don't live in the USA
customer_reviews.text: You won't be able to use this item properly out of the USA. So if you don't live there, don't buy. Their system will not allow your credit card to purchase from their app and website if your credit card is registered in countries other than USA. You won't be able to buy designs or tools
customer_reviews.author: Tiziana

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine
customer_reviews.text: I had the explore one and have had it for years my husband order me this one and I'm in love cuts smoother and faster. I love how I can do alot more with this machine as well. It's great for my small at home buisness
customer_reviews.author: Harris Services

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use and cuts are  amazing
customer_reviews.text: Great machine, great price! I love my cricut. I bought it after using my mothers a few time and I’m so glad I did. So easy to use for beginners. I’ve used it not for about 2 months for hours each time, and I’ve cut hundreds of stencils and decals and my blade is still cutting perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Kari Preston

customer_reviews.title: Can you navigate graphic design lingo?
customer_reviews.text: Some knowledge of graphic design would be very helpful. I'm still learning (self taught means lots of mistakes). Important that you read which cutting mat to use. Anything with "doily fine" cuts has to be stuck to the mat very well. Use You tube for problem solving like removing your projects from the mat. Join a support group.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Duvall

customer_reviews.title: Excited
customer_reviews.text: So I went through hell over this thing, package was missing and come to find out a neighbor stole it😒 Any who, now that I’ve got to play with it a little i think they it’s pretty cool machine. I’m excited to make some amazing things with it.
customer_reviews.author: _NM

customer_reviews.title: Worth every Penny!!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE IT!!!! The app is a little hard to use however Cricut has an amazing YouTube channel with a lot of good videos. All of the extra blades and tool are very pricey however I knew that when I got it. I really do love it and have enjoyed it very much! I only wish I had more time to use it...
customer_reviews.author: Hali D.

customer_reviews.title: It’s amaze-balls
customer_reviews.text: It’s beautiful and so so cool. I sat there with my mouth agape as I made my first project and watched the machine make a stunning card. I can’t even begin to describe all the amazing things you can create with this machine. I’m VERY happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Arielle

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects frequently
customer_reviews.text: For some reason the cricut design space freezes all the time and constantly disconnects from the machine. Simple projects take forever because of this Design space is the worst.
customer_reviews.author: Nuhi&co

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: It takes work to really know how to fully use this product! But it is so amazing! I will ALWAYS suggest this product to people. If you just want to do basic ctafts and never venture into anything else the explore air will work fine, but the maker is the one for you if you want all the options! Works best with a laptop in my opinion. The price is also better than any store i could find it at.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Know before you buy.
customer_reviews.text: Be careful to read about the requirements of the machine if you have an Apple computer.
customer_reviews.author: Joni

product_meta.title: Cricut Maker, Champagne
product_meta.description: Color:Champagne| Style:MakerIntroducing the ultimate smart cutting machine. With its expandable suite of tools and advanced Rotary and Knife blades, Circuit Maker gives you the freedom to make virtually any DIY project. Circuit Maker cuts hundreds of materials, from the most delicate fabric and paper to mat board and leather. It’s professional level cutting performance, accessible to everyone.Compatible with Knife Blade for thicker materials up to 2.4 mm (sold separately).Compatible with Scoring Wheel for razor sharp creases in cardstock, poster board, and more (sold separately).Compatible with Washable Fabric Pen for marking pattern pieces (sold separately). TIP: The Cutting Mat surface is tacky to hold the paper in place during cutting. Remove paper slowly when using lightweight materials such as vellum,Cricut machine needs 1 foot (30.5 cm) of clear space in the front and back for paper movement in and out of the Cricut machine. Recommended thatpapers be no smaller than 3inches x 3inches.
feature_bullets: Create more Cricut Maker gives you the freedom to make everything from paper crafts, iron ons, and vinyl decals to sewing projects, leather crafts, and balsa models
[Endless project possibilities] Expandable suite of tools. With its powerful blades, pens, and scoring tool, Cricut Maker grows with you as you learn each new craft
[New rotary blade for fabrics] With its gliding, rolling action, this blade cuts through virtually any fabric quickly and accurately – without backing material

[Access to hundreds of digital sewing projects] Simplifies sewing and quilting projects. Choose from hundreds of digital sewing patterns, and Cricut Maker cuts and marks all the pieces – you just sew them together

[Design for free] Simple design apps. Lay out your project on your mobile device or computer easily and conveniently, whether you’re a beginner or a pro. You can always upload and use your own images and fonts for free, in a variety of standard file formats
[Thoughtful details] A helpful docking slot holds your tablet or smartphone while you’re busy. Charge your device using the convenient USB port

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars4,980 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
